wikipedia_page.main: Joseph Walsh (c. 1944 – 24 December 2008) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1960s and 1970s. He played at representative level for Great Britain, and at club level for Leigh (Heritage No. 735), and Warrington (Heritage No. 797), as a wing, i.e. number 2 or 5.

response: *Joseph Walsh (Massachusetts politician) (1875–1946), American jurist and congressman, 1915–1922
*Joseph Walsh (rugby league) (1944–2008), English footballer at wing for Leigh and Great Britain
*Joseph Walsh (designer) (born 1979), Irish designer and furniture maker
*Joseph Walshe (1886–1956), Irish Minister for Foreign Affairs
